ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Professor Elliot has taught this course enough that he can do it with his eyes closed. His experience was invaluable andhis ego (while in many ways deserved) was comical. You could still tell when he was winging it.

It was an excellent class, so wonderful to be taught by someone that is such an expert in the field. Ifeel, in response to question 12, that this class is a very necessary foundation for students with interest in environmental work. A basic understanding of some of the most significant environmental laws is integral to working in the environmental field, and this class does an excellent job of teaching those foundations.

The casebook readings were very helpful for understanding of the material, however if I have one criticism of the class in general, it is that a closer reading of the cases would lead to a deeper understanding of the laws.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The professor's expertise and knowledge of the material being taught.
Certain classes: Risk Assessment, Legal Modes of Thought, Climate Change, CAA, Best and Worst of US law
Professor had an excellent sense of humor and made lectures fun.
Professor Elliott is very knowledgable and the book is great.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I would have liked a few assignments during the semester to force me to think more deeply about the reading. But that would be so un-law school.Given that so many non-law students take this course, I'd consider switching textbooks. Without law school training, I found it was much easier for me to read law summaries on epa.gov and other online sights.
Increase student questions/discussion, particularly on Notes&Questions from Revesz casebook (treat explicitly). Occasional discussion of biofuels plant in New Haven was not that helpful.
Deepen scrutiny of readings?
More accountability is needed for students to do the reading. Lecture should not review the reading so much.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: NA

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Interested in environmental policy and economics.
Great to have cross-listed classes.
Like many at FES, I focus on policy and environmental law is the basis for much of what we do. I was also hoping to get some of the philosophies behind different laws/solutions.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: See above
I had heard great things about the course and the professor and have a strong interest in the material being taught in the course.
To gain an understanding of US environmental law and how it affects the environmental work being done.
For breadth.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Sure. It was an ok survey course.
Yes
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Get a supplementary book that explains environmental law in common English.
Do the readings, don't miss class, and participate in class.
Consider pairing this with another law school course to deepen knowledge of fundamentals in law.
